#Text=Former US president Carter meets with former deputy-PM for Hamas
#Text=Wednesday , April 16 , 2008
#Text=Former President of the United States , Jimmy Carter met with Nasser al-Shaer on Tuesday .
#Text=Shaer is a former education minister and a former Deputy Prime Minister of the Palestinian National Authority .
#Text=He is considered a high-ranking member of Hamas .
#Text=During a visit to the West Bank , Carter laid a wreath upon the grave site of Yasser Arafat in Ramallah .
#Text=Carter then met with Shaer , whom he greeted with a hug and kisses to both cheeks , according to a member of Carter 's delegation .
#Text=Shaer told Reuters that he and Carter had a face-to-face meeting and that they discussed brokering an unofficial truce between Israel and Palestinian militants in the Gaza Strip .
#Text=Hamas seized control of the Gaza Strip in June of 2007 .
#Text=Carter 's office has declined to comment on the closed meeting .
#Text=" Carter asked what he can do to achieve peace between the Palestinians and Israel ...

#Text=Carter  in effect is undermining a current policy which is not just American but held by many others , " said U.S. Representative Howard Berman to the Associated Press .

column1: #Text=Berman is the chairperson for the Committee on Foreign Affairs .
#Text=Since Syria and Hamas will have to be involved in a final peace agreement , they have to be involved in discussions that lead to final peace .
#Text=— Jimmy Carter
#Text=Friday , Carter is scheduled to meet in Damascus , Syria with Khaled Mashal , who is considered the political leader of Hamas and is the head of its Syrian branch .

#Text=Jimmy Carter 's view of the forces at work in the Middle East and how he likes to attribute blame and responsibility is so warped to my way of thinking that I 'm skeptical of any initiative he undertakes . — U.S. Rep. Howard Berman , Chairperson , Committee on Foreign Affairs

#Text=Yigal Palmor , an official with the Israeli Foreign Ministry said , " The official Hamas position until this day is that it wo n't negotiate with Israel or recognize it under any circumstance ...

#Text=Jimmy Carter has dignified this position with his presence , and one cannot but wonder how this attitude is supposed to promote peace and understanding .

_	_	_	_

#Text= Since Syria and Hamas will have to be involved in a final peace agreement , they have to be involved in discussions that lead to final peace , " Jimmy Carter told reporters in Ramallah .

column1: #Text=" Jimmy Carter 's view of the forces at work in the Middle East and how he likes to attribute blame and responsibility is so warped to my way of thinking that I 'm skeptical of any initiative he undertakes , " said Howard Berman .
#Text=While in Israel , Carter met with Israeli President Shimon Peres , who criticized the planned meeting with Mashal .
#Text=Ehud Olmert , the Prime Minister of Israel did not receive Carter .
